intro: Hieracium pollichiae, commonly known as the Pollich's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 centimeters, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium pollichiae is often found in meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in well-drained soils.
